Trade/Device Name(s): BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System - Ampicillin 0.5-32 μg/mL E
BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System for use with Ampicillin 0.5-32 μg/mL - Gram-negative ID/AST or AST only Phoenix panels
Regulation Name(s): Fully automated short-term incubation cycle antimicrobial susceptibility system
Specimen Type(s): Isolates from pure culture of aerobic and facultative anaerobic Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria of human origin
Specimen Container(s): Phoenix panels (molded polystyrene tray with micro-wells)
Document Summary: FDA 510(k) summary for BD Phoenix™M Automated Microbiology System using Ampicillin for AST of aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria isolates
Indications for Use Summary: For rapid identification and in vitro antimicrobial susceptibility testing by MIC of isolates from pure culture of most Gram-negative aerobic and facultative anaerobic bacteria, including Enterobacteriaceae and Non-Enterobacteriaceae, and Gram-positive isolates from Staphylococcus, Enterococcus, and Streptococcus, using Ampicillin panels
